   31.64 through 31.69   Reserved
Village Budget Officer
   
31.70   Office established; appointment and term of office
   
31.71   Bond
   
31.72   Powers and duties
OFFICERS AND EMPLOYEES GENERALLY
§ 31.01 PROVISIONS AND DEFINITIONS.
   Section 31.01 through 31.11 shall apply to all appointed officers and
employees of the village, regardless of the time of the creation of the office
or position or the time of the appointment of the officer or employee. Wherever
the following words or phrases are used, they shall, for purposes of this
chapter, have the meanings ascribed to them in this section, except when the
context otherwise indicates:
   (A)   Employee. All at-will positions appointed by the Village Manager or
other positions governed by a collective bargaining agreement.
   (B)   Officer. All village elected officials, the Village Treasurer,
appointed members of Village commissions and boards, and the Village Manager.
§ 31.02 APPOINTMENT OF EMPLOYEES.
   Except as specifically provided to the contrary by law or this code, all
employees shall be appointed by the Village Manager.
§ 31.03 FAILURE TO QUALIFY FOR OFFICE.
   If any appointed officer fails to qualify for office within 30 days, except
as otherwise specified by ordinance or statute, from the time he or she is
notified by the Village Clerk of his or her appointment, the office shall be
deemed vacant.
§ 31.04 TERM OF OFFICE FOR APPOINTED OFFICERS.
   Appointed officers of the village shall hold office for a term of one year
commencing on May 1 and ending on April 30 of the following year, or until his
or her successor is elected or appointed and qualified, unless otherwise
provided herein or by ordinance. Except as otherwise provided by law, any
officer appointed by the Village President with the consent of the Board of
Trustees may be removed by the Village President at any time without cause.
§ 31.05 VACANCY.
   In the event a vacancy occurs, it shall be filled in the same manner in
which appointments are made in the absence of provisions to the contrary.
§ 31.06 OATH OF OFFICE.
   Every officer of the village, except appointed members of village
commissions and boards shall, before entering upon his or her duties, take the
oath or affirmation prescribed by statute. This oath or affirmation, so
subscribed, shall be filed with the Village Clerk.
§ 31.07 COMPENSATION.
   Appointed officers and employees of the village shall receive such
compensation as may from time to time be provided by the Board of Trustees or
by ordinance.
§ 31.08 INSPECTION OF RECORDS.
   All records kept by any officer or employee of the village shall be open to
inspection at all reasonable times by the President, any Village Trustee, or
the Village Manager whether or not such records are required to be kept by
statute or ordinance.
§ 31.09 DELIVERY OF RECORDS UPON TERMINATION.
   All officers of the village, upon the expiration of their terms or
employment for whatever cause, shall deliver to their successors all property,
books, records and effects belonging to the village, or appertaining to the
office they have held, within five days after notification and request to do
so. If no successor has been appointed, such property shall be delivered to the
Village Clerk or Village Treasurer. Any officer that violates this section
shall be liable for all the damages caused thereby and shall be fined in the
amount set forth in the annual fee resolution.
§ 31.10 MONIES RECEIVED.
   All officers of the village shall turn over to the Village Treasurer all
monies paid to the village and received by the officer or employee in his or
her official capacity, within five days of receipt, along with a statement
showing the sources from which the money was received.
§ 31.11 MISCONDUCT OF OFFICERS.
   Every village officer who is guilty of a culpable omission of duty, or who
is guilty of willful and corrupt oppression, misconduct, or malfeasance in the
discharge of the duties of his or her office, shall be guilty of a business
offense and, on conviction, shall be fined in an amount established in §
10.99 of this code.
§§ 31.12 THROUGH 31.19 RESERVED.
VILLAGE TREASURER
§ 31.20 OFFICE ESTABLISHED; APPOINTMENT AND TERM OF OFFICE.
   There is hereby established the office of Village Treasurer, who shall be
appointed by the Village President, with the advice and consent of the Board of
Trustees. The Village Treasurer shall serve from the date of his or her
appointment and qualification until the end of the fiscal year and until his or
her successor has been duly appointed and qualified, and shall immediately
relinquish his or her office and its records to such person as may be named as
his or her successor.
§ 31.21 QUALIFICATIONS.
   (A)   No person shall be eligible to hold the office of Village Treasurer
unless he or she is a qualified elector of the village and has resided therein
at least one year preceding his or her appointment.
   (B)   No person shall be eligible to hold the office of Village Treasurer
who is in arrears in the payment of any tax or other indebtedness due to the
village.
§ 31.22 BOND.
   The Village Treasurer, before entering upon the duties of his or her office,
shall execute a bond in a sum as shall be determined from time to time by
ordinance or resolution of the Board of Trustees that is an amount not less
than that is required by Illinois Municipal Code, 65 ILCS 5/1-1-1 et seq., as
amended, conditioned upon the faithful performance of his or her duties, to be
approved by the corporate authorities and filed with the Village Clerk. The
premium of such bond shall be paid by the village.
§ 31.23 GENERAL DUTIES.
   (A)   The Village Treasurer, or his or her designee, shall exercise the
powers and duties prescribed by law and ordinance and other duties as may be
required of him or her from time to time by ordinance or resolution of the
Board of Trustees.
   (B)   The Village Treasurer shall keep books and accounts in such manner as
required by statute or ordinance, in accordance with good accounting practice,
and in the manner prescribed by the Board of Trustees. The Village Treasurer
shall keep records showing all money received by him or her, showing the source
from which it is received and the purpose for which it is paid, and shall keep
records at all times showing the financial status of the village.
   (C)   When required by the corporate authorities, the Village Treasurer
shall make a written report of all money collected by him or her, the account
whereon collected, and any other matter pertaining to his or her office.
§ 31.24 DEPOSIT OF FUNDS; PRIVATE USE OF FUNDS.
   The Village Treasurer shall keep all funds belonging to the village on
deposit in the official depositories designated by the Village Board, in manner
provided by law, which funds shall be so deposited to the credit of the proper
bank account in the name of the village. The Village Treasurer shall keep the
deposit of the municipal money separate and distinct from his or her own money,
and shall not make private or personal use of any municipal money.
§ 31.25 SPECIAL ASSESSMENT FUNDS.
   The Village Treasurer shall keep all special assessment warrant books,
publish for delinquent special assessments and send notices of such
delinquencies to the County Collector, all as prescribed by statute. All monies
received on any special assessment shall be held by the Village Treasurer in
special funds, one for each assessment, to be applied only to the payment of
the improvement, or bonds and vouchers issued therefor, together with interest
thereon, for which the assessment was made. Such monies shall be used for no
other purpose, unless to reimburse the village for money expended for such
improvement. Payment on bonds or vouchers shall be made in accordance with
applicable law, and the Village Treasurer shall keep books and accounts in such
a manner that proper prorations in payments of principal and interest can be
made and ascertained.
§ 31.26 WARRANTS; PAYMENT OF BILLS; TRANSFER OF FUNDS.
   Bills and obligations of the village shall be paid in accordance with the
following requirements:
   (A)   Classification of warrants. Warrants are classified and defined as
follows:
      (1)   Class A warrants are all warrants that are not Class B warrants;
and
      (2)   Class B warrants are warrants relating to payroll and non-payroll
taxes; utility payments; flat rate contractual services; monthly credit card
charges; the reimbursement of imprest accounts established for the payment of
health care and worker’s compensation claims; the return of funds from escrow
accounts; payments to correct an error; and items which, in the judgment of the
Village Manager, should be paid prior to the next regular meeting of the Board
of Trustees to avoid additional expense to the village. If the item is $20,000
or more, the Board must have previously approved the expenditure.
   (B)   Approval/ratification of warrants.
      (1)   All warrants shall be signed by the Village President and
countersigned by the Village Clerk upon approval or ratification of the same by
the Village Board.
      (2)   All Class A warrants shall require the approval of the Village
Board, in connection with the warrants list procedure, prior to the issuance of
the same.
      (3)   All Class B warrants may be issued by the Village Treasurer or
without prior approval of the Village Board; provided, however, that the
issuance of Class B warrants shall be ratified by the Village Board, in
connection with the warrants list procedure, at the next regular or special
meeting of the Village Board.
   (C)   Warrants list procedure. A list of all Class A warrants to be paid,
and all Class B warrants previously paid, shall be prepared by the Village
Treasurer and submitted to the Village Board for review on a monthly basis, or
a more or less frequent basis, as the Village Treasurer may deem necessary.
Approval by the Village Board of the warrants list by a roll call vote at a
regular or special meeting of the Village Board shall constitute approval of
all Class A warrants and ratification of all Class B warrants; provided that
the Village Board may, in its sole discretion, except from the approval
specific Class A warrants, in which case the Class A warrants shall not be
issued.
   (D)   Method of payment. Warrants issued pursuant to this section shall be
paid by the Village Treasurer only in the form of a check, wire or other
electronic transfer.
   (E)   Signatures required. All Class A warrants and all Class B warrants
shall be signed by the Village President and shall be countersigned by the
Village Treasurer. In the absence of the Village Treasurer, all checks shall be
manually countersigned by the Village Manager.
   (F)   Facsimile signature. The signatures of the Village President and
Village Treasurer on checks and warrants issued pursuant to this §
31.26 may be by facsimile signature provided that the facsimile signature
complies with the requirements of the Uniform Facsimile Signature of Public
Officials Act (30 ILCS 320/1 et seq.).
   (G)   Maturity account. For convenience in paying matured bonds, coupons and
similar obligations to unknown owners on due date, the Village Treasurer shall
keep a fiscal agency account in the official depository bank, to which account
funds for paying all maturing obligations shall be transferred by regular
village warrant, duly countersigned, after which the funds shall be disbursed
by the trust department of the official depository bank, as fiscal agent, on
written authorization of the Village President, the Village Clerk and the
Village Treasurer or by a resolution of the Village Board, and not otherwise.
   (H)   Reports. In conjunction with the Village Comptroller, Village
Collector and Village Auditors, the Village Treasurer shall make reports of the
finances of the village as may be required by law or ordinances of the village.
   (I)   Cancelled warrants and securities. The Village Treasurer shall cancel
all warrants and securities paid and redeemed by him or her and shall deliver
the same, monthly, to the Village Comptroller for filing in the village office.
(Am. Ord. 1141, passed 4-20-2015; Am. Ord. 1150, passed 8-17-2015)
§ 31.27 ANNUAL REPORT OF VILLAGE TREASURER.
   Within six months after the end of each fiscal year, the Village Treasurer
shall prepare and file with the Village Clerk an account of all monies received
and expenditures incurred during the fiscal year just ended, as prescribed by
state law. A copy of the annual account of the Village Treasurer shall also be
filed with the County Collector of Taxes who collects taxes levied by the
Village, together with an affidavit of the Village Clerk certifying its
publication as required by law and its correctness.
§ 31.28 ADDITIONAL DUTIES.
   In addition to the duties herein provided, the Village Treasurer shall
perform such other duties and functions as may be required of municipal
treasurers or of municipal collectors by statute or ordinance.
§§ 31.29 THROUGH 31.39 RESERVED.
VILLAGE MANAGER
§ 31.40 CREATION AND APPOINTMENT.
   The office of Village Manager is hereby created as a full-time position. The
Village Manager may not engage in other employment without the approval of the
Board of Trustees. The Village Manager shall be appointed by the Village
President and Trustees, voting jointly.
§ 31.41 TERM OF OFFICE.
   The term of office of the Village Manager shall be as provided by written
contract between the Village and the Village Manager.
§ 31.42 TEMPORARY ABSENCE OR PERMANENT VACANCY.
   If the Village Manager temporarily is unable to perform the duties of the
office, the Village Manager may appoint a temporary successor to act as acting
Village Manager to perform the duties of the office for a period of 15 days or
less, and may appoint a temporary successor for a longer period with the
approval of the Board of Trustees. If a permanent vacancy occurs, the vacancy
shall be filled in accordance with the appointment procedures set forth in §
31.05 of this code.
§ 31.43 COMPENSATION.
   The Village Manager shall receive compensation in such amount and manner as
provided in the written contract between the village and the Village Manager.
§ 31.44 BOND.
   Before entering upon the duties of the office, the Village Manager shall
execute a bond in a sum as shall be determined from time to time by ordinance
or resolution of the Board of Trustees, conditioned upon the faithful
performance of his or her duties, and shall be conditioned to indemnify the
village for any loss by reason of any neglect of duty or any act of the Village
Manager. The bond shall be approved by the corporate authorities and filed with
the Village Clerk. The premium of such bond shall be paid by the village.
§ 31.45 POWERS AND DUTIES.
   The Village Manager shall have the following powers and shall perform the
following duties:
   (A)   General duties. The Village Manager shall act as the business and
administrative officer and manager of the village, under the direction of the
Village Board and in cooperation with the President, Clerk, Treasurer, Village
Legal Counsel and other elective or appointive officials, and he or she shall
be responsible for the supervision and management of all administrative
departments, employees and officers of the village except where the management
and control of any department or office is expressly delegated elsewhere by law
or by ordinance of the village.
   (B)   Personnel. Subject to the general supervision of the Village Board and
to the limitations imposed by adoption of a budget or special appropriation,
the Village Manager shall appoint and fix the salaries and wages of all
administrative officers and employees whose appointment is not otherwise
provided by law or ordinance, and he or she shall have the power and authority
to remove all officers and employees appointed by him or her.
   (C)   Purchasing and contracting. The Village Manager shall act ex officio
as purchasing agent and shall exercise and perform, or superintend and direct,
all duties and be subject to all requirements and obligations pertaining to
that office, in accordance with the following provisions.
      (1)   Reports. The Village Manager shall prepare, or cause to be
prepared, reports which may be called for by the Village Board from time to
time, showing in detail satisfactory to the Village Board purchases made under
the provisions of this section.
      (2)   General. Subject to the direction of and powers reserved to the
Village Board, the Village Manager shall purchase or approve the purchase of
all construction, repair and maintenance projects, supplies and services for
the village, as provided in this section.
      (3)   Rules and regulations. The Village Manager shall have the power to
issue rules and regulations that set forth the processes and requirements for
all purchases made by the village.
      (4)   Budget or appropriation required. No purchase shall be made without
an approved budgetary allocation or appropriation by the Village Board in the
amount of the purchase.
      (5)   Approval of purchases. The Village Manager, or his or her designee,
shall have the power to make all purchases involving a total expenditure of
less than $20,000. All other purchases shall require the approval of the
Village Board.
      (6)   Competitive bidding. Any work or other public improvement, not
constructed under the Local Improvements Act, when the expense shall exceed
$20,000, shall be let by contract to the lowest responsible bidder, after
advertising for bids in a newspaper of general circulation in the village, not
less than 15 days prior to the date bids are to be received; provided, however,
that any contract may be entered into without advertising for bids upon the
affirmative vote of two-thirds of all the Trustees then holding office.
      (7)   Credit purchases. The Village Manager is authorized to approve the
use of credit cards and credit accounts for officials and employees of the
village to reasonably facilitate the making of purchases in amounts of less
than $20,000 pursuant to this section. Any purchases made using credit shall be
within approved budget allocations and appropriations.
      (8)   Examination and execution of contracts. The Village Manager shall
examine all proposed contracts governed by this section to which the village
may be a party, and may sign on behalf of the village any contract and other
documents necessary to complete any purchase approved by the Village Board,
except where the Village Board directs that some other officer or officers
shall do so.
      (9)   Emergency purchases. The Village Manager may make purchases and
enter into contracts on behalf of the village in the case of accidents or other
circumstances creating an emergency where necessary to protect life, the public
health and safety and public property, by a process as may be practicable under
the circumstances. All emergency procurements involving expenditures of $20,000
or more must be presented to the Village Board for ratification at the next
scheduled Village Board meeting.
      (10)   Contract performance. The Village Manager shall be responsible to
assure that the terms of any contract governed by this section to which the
village is a party are properly performed by all parties.
      (11)   Approval of payments. No bill shall be paid for goods purchased
unless the person requisitioning the purchase shall have indicated to the
Village Manager that the goods have been received and unless the bill shall be
approved by the person who requisitioned the purchase and the Village Manager.
      (12)   Petty cash. Authorized petty cash funds may be used for purchases
by persons other than the Village Manager and may be replenished if
requisitions for purchases out of the funds shall be approved by the Village
Manager.
   (D)   Budget estimate and administrative reports. The Village Manager shall
prepare and present to the Village Board, prior to the expiration of each
fiscal year, a budget estimate of general fund income and expenditures for the
ensuing year. He or she shall at all times keep the Village President and Board
informed of the operation of the village government, and when requested,
prepare and present to the Board a written report summarizing the work of each
department, and an annual report thereof, including a statement of the
financial condition of the village, together with his or her recommendations.
   (E)   Attendance at meetings. The Village Manager shall attend all regular
meetings of the Village Board and the special meetings thereof and of
committees as the Village Board may direct. He or she shall hold conferences
with the Village Board, regular or special committees thereof and officers of
the village, as are necessary to keep them informed.
   (F)   Issuance of licenses and permits. The Village Manager shall have the
power and authority to issue on behalf of the village, all licenses and permits
not otherwise provided for. Any and all fees and moneys belonging to the
village or in the custody of the village, collected by the Village Manager in
the discharge of his or her duties as such, as Village Collector, Village
Comptroller or otherwise, shall be paid into the village treasury as received
by him or her.
   (G)   Custodian of properties and additional duties. The Village Manager
shall have charge of all public streets, alleys, gutters, parkways and of all
sanitary and storm sewer systems, and shall be custodian of all village
property which is not assigned to the care or custody of any other officer. He
or she shall have charge of the collection and disposal of garbage, ashes and
refuse by the village, and shall perform other duties as may be required of him
or her from time to time by ordinance, resolution or direction of the Village
Board.
   (H)   Other duties. The Village Manager shall perform such other and
additional duties as may be required by the Village President or Board of
Trustees from time to time.
(Am. Ord. 1150, passed 8-17-2015)
§§ 31.46 THROUGH 31.49 RESERVED.
VILLAGE COMPTROLLER
§ 31.50 OFFICE ESTABLISHED; APPOINTMENT AND TERM OF OFFICE.
   There is hereby established the office of Village Comptroller, an executive
office of the village. The Village Manager shall be ex officio Village
Comptroller for the term of his or her office as Manager and until his or her
successor is appointed and qualifies.
§ 31.51 BOND.
   The Village Manager’s bond shall be conditioned also upon the faithful
discharge of his or her duties as Village Comptroller and no additional bond
shall be required.
§ 31.52 COMPENSATION.
   The Village Manager shall receive no compensation other than his or her
salary as Village Manager for performing his or her duties as Comptroller.
§ 31.53 POWERS AND DUTIES.
   (A)   General duties. The Comptroller shall exercise general supervision
over all officers and employees of the village charged in any manner with the
receipt, collection or disbursement of revenues belonging to the village and
the collection and return of all revenues into the village treasury. He or she
shall have charge, custody and control of all warrants, vouchers, books,
records and documents, the custody and control of which is not herein given to
any other officer.
   (B)   Accounts. The Comptroller shall keep complete accounting records of
all financial transactions of the village, in accordance with good accounting
practice and subject to the general supervision of the Village Board.
   (C)   Annual tax levy ordinance. The Comptroller shall prepare an annual tax
levy ordinance, in manner and form provided by law, and submit the annual tax
levy ordinance to the Village Board for consideration as provided by law. The
Comptroller shall promptly file a certified copy of the annual tax levy
ordinance after its passage and approval with the County Clerk.
   (D)   Expenditures to be within appropriations. Except as otherwise provided
by law, no contract shall hereafter be made by the Village Board, or any
committee or member thereof, and no expense shall be incurred by any officers
or employees of the village, whether ordered by the Village Board or not,
unless the expenditure was previously budgeted.
   (E)   Financial reports. The Comptroller shall prepare and present to the
Village Board statements showing the financial condition of the village, when
requested and in detail as may be desired by the Village Board and as required
by law.
   (F)   Warrants. The Comptroller shall prepare all warrants drawn on the
Treasury by the authority of the Village Board, and all warrants shall be
signed by the President and countersigned by the Clerk and Treasurer, stating
the particular fund or budget to which the same is chargeable and the person to
whom payable; and no money shall be paid other than upon the warrants so drawn,
except as provided by law or ordinance of the village.
   (G)   Clerical assistance. The Comptroller shall have authority and it shall
be his or her duty to appoint, subject to approval of the Village Board, an
accountant and bookkeeper or other clerical help as may be required; provided,
however, that the appointments shall not relieve the Comptroller of full
responsibility for the fidelity of his or her appointees or for the proper
discharge of his or her duties.
   (H)   Additional duties. The Comptroller shall perform other duties as may
be required of him or her from time to time by ordinance or resolution of the
Village Board or by law.
§§ 31.54 THROUGH 31.59 RESERVED.
VILLAGE COLLECTOR
§ 31.60 OFFICE ESTABLISHED; APPOINTMENT AND TERM OF OFFICE.
   There is hereby established the office of Village Collector, an executive
office of the village. The Village Manager shall be ex officio Village
Comptroller for the term of his or her office as Manager and until his or her
successor is appointed and qualifies.
§ 31.61 BOND.
   The Village Manager’s bond shall be conditioned also upon the faithful
discharge of his or her duties as Village Collector and no additional bond
shall be required.
§ 31.62 COMPENSATION.
   The Village Manager shall receive no compensation other than his or her
salary as Village Manager for performing his or her duties as Collector.
§ 31.63 POWERS AND DUTIES.
   (A)   General duties.
      (1)   Except as otherwise provided by law or ordinance, the Village
Collector shall have the authority and it shall be his or her duty to collect
all moneys due the village, to issue receipts therefor and to keep a complete
and accurate account in books of original entry in accordance with good
accounting practices and subject to the general supervision of the Village
Board.
      (2)   The Village Collector shall be authorized to accept payment of
moneys due to the village by credit card. The Village Manager may enter into
agreements to process credit and debit card payments with card servicing
companies so long as the terms of these agreements are not less advantageous to
the village than the terms that are commonly available to other organizations
accepting these forms of payment.
      (3)   All books, accounts and papers pertaining to his or her office
shall be at all times open to inspection by the Village President, Village
Clerk or any Village Trustee.
   (B)   Remittance to Village Treasurer. He or she shall promptly pay over to
the Village Treasurer all moneys collected by him or her, and shall at the time
of the remittances, advise the Village Treasurer of the account to which the
remittances should be credited.
   (C)   Deposit account. There is hereby established a deposit account in
which the Collector shall deposit all water, contractors and other similar
deposits paid to him or her in the name of the village and in an official
depository bank designated by the Village Board.
   (D)   Additional duties. The Village Collector shall perform other duties as
may be from time to time required of him or her by ordinance or resolution of
the Village Board or by law.
§§ 31.64 THROUGH 31.69 RESERVED.
VILLAGE BUDGET OFFICER
§ 31.70 OFFICE ESTABLISHED; APPOINTMENT AND TERM OF OFFICE.
   There is hereby created the Office of the Village Budget Officer who shall
be designated by the Village President, with the approval of the corporate
authorities. The Village Budget Officer shall serve at the pleasure of the
Village President and may be removed by the Village President at any time. The
Village Budget Officer may hold another village office or position, either
elected or appointed, and may receive compensation for both offices, unless one
of the offices is a full-time position for which the officer is being
compensated for on a full-time basis. If the Village Budget Officer is to be
compensated, the compensation shall be determined from time to time by the
Village President and Board of Trustees.
§ 31.71 BOND.
   The Budget Officer, before entering into office, shall execute a bond in a
sum as shall be determined from time to time by ordinance or resolution of the
Board of Trustees, conditioned upon the faithful performance of his or her
duties, and shall be conditioned to indemnify the village for any loss by
reason of any neglect of duty or any act of the Budget Officer. The bond shall
be approved by the corporate authorities and filed with the Village Clerk. The
premium of such bond shall be paid by the village.
§ 31.72 POWERS AND DUTIES.
   (A)   General duties. The Budget Officer shall perform the duties and
responsibilities set forth in Sections 8-2-9.1 through 8-2-9.10 of the Illinois
Municipal Code, 65 ILCS 5/1-1-1 et seq., as amended.
   (B)   Alter sub-classes. The Village Budget Officer shall have the authority
to delete, add to, change or create sub-classes within object classes
previously budgeted.
   (C)   Transfer of funds. The Village Budget Officer may, with the approval
of the Finance Committee, transfer funds within the approved annual budget upon
submission of a proper request from the head of any village department, board
or commission and subject to the following conditions:
      (1)   Transfers may not be made between or among funds;
      (2)   Transfers may not be made between or among departments, boards or
commissions;
      (3)   Transfers may be made:
         (a)   Between or among subclasses within an object class; and
         (b)   Between or among object classes; provided, however, that each
transfer shall be within the same fund and provided further that, where more
than one department, commission or division is within a fund, each transfer
shall be within that department, commission or division;
      (4)   Transfers shall not exceed $5,000;
      (5)   Transfers to or from a particular account shall not exceed a
reasonable number in each fiscal year, as determined by the Budget Officer and
the Finance Committee; and
      (6)   Transfers may be made from one account to one or more other
accounts only if, at the time of the transfer, sufficient uncommitted and
unspent funds are in the account from which the funds are to be transferred.

DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC WORKS
§ 32.01 CREATION OF DEPARTMENT.
   There is hereby created a Public Works Department, an administrative
department of the village, which shall consist of a Director of Public Works
and any other employees as may from time to time be appointed.
§ 32.02 DIRECTOR OF PUBLIC WORKS.
   (A)   Position created. There is hereby created the position of Director of
Public Works, who shall be an employee and not an officer of the village.
   (B)   Powers and duties.
      (1)   General duties. The Director of Public Works shall have direct
charge and control over the Department of Public Works and shall be responsible
for the faithful and efficient conduct and operation of the Department.
      (2)   Street and public property maintenance. The Director of Public
Works shall have charge of the maintenance and improvement of all streets,
parkways and village-owned parks, including the maintenance of trees, shrubs
and other plantings thereon, and of all buildings, grounds and equipment
belonging to the village except that which is expressly delegated to the
supervision of other officers and departments.
      (3)   Issuance of street permits. The Director of Public Works shall be
responsible to review, prior to issuance, all permits for the opening,
occupation or use of public streets, parkways, sidewalks and alleys, for public
utility equipment, tree planting or removal, private driveway and sidewalk
approaches and all other purposes authorized by law, ordinance or resolution of
the Board of Trustees.
      (4)   Water and sewer systems. The Director of Public Works shall have
charge of the safe and efficient operation of the water treatment plant and its
related infrastructure, including water mains and meters, and the sanitary and
storm sewer systems of the village.
      (5)   Additional duties. The Director of Public Works shall enforce, in
coordination with the Village Manager, all provisions of this code and any
other ordinance of the village relating to them, except traffic ordinances, and
shall perform any other duties as may be required of him or her by law,
ordinance or resolution of the Village Board.
§§ 32.03 THROUGH 32.09 RESERVED.
DEPARTMENT OF COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT
§ 32.10 CREATION OF DEPARTMENT.
   There is hereby created a Community Development Department, an
administrative department of the village, which shall consist of a Director of
Community Development and any other employees as may from time to time be
appointed.
§ 32.11 DIRECTOR OF COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT.
   (A)   Position created. There is hereby created the position of Director of
Community Development, who shall be an employee and not an officer of the
Village. The Village Manager shall appoint the Director of Community
Development.
   (B)   Powers and duties.
      (1)   General duties. The Director of Community Development shall have
direct charge and control over the Department of Community Development and
shall be responsible for the faithful and efficient conduct and operation of
the Department.
      (2)   Enforcement. The Director of Community Development shall enforce,
in coordination with the Building Commissioner, the building and construction
regulations, the zoning ordinance, and all laws and ordinances pertaining to
his or her Department.
      (3)   Additional powers and duties. The Director of Community Development
shall have the same powers provided to the Building Inspector in §
32.13(C) of this code, as well and duty to perform any other duties as may be
required of him or her by law, ordinance or resolution of the Village Board.
§ 32.12 BUILDING COMMISSIONER.
   (A)   Position created. There is hereby created the Office of Building
Commissioner, an administrative office of the village. The Village Manager, or
his or her designee, shall serve as Building Commissioner, unless some other
person is appointed to the position by the Village Board.
   (B)   Oath and bond of Commissioner. Before entering upon the duties of his
or her office, the Building Commissioner shall take the oath of office
prescribed by statute, and furnish a bond determined from time to time by
ordinance or resolution of the Village Board.
   (C)   Powers and duties. The Building Commissioner shall enforce, or cause
to be enforced, the building and construction regulations, the zoning
ordinance, and all laws and ordinances pertaining to his or her Department, and
shall have any other duties as the Village Board may from time to time
prescribe.
(Ord. 1051, passed 11-15-2010)
§ 32.13 BUILDING INSPECTOR.
   (A)   Position created. There is hereby created the position of Building
Inspector. The Village Manager shall appoint the Building Inspector.
   (B)   Compensation. Whenever any person holding any other village office is
serving as Building Inspector, he or she shall receive no salary or
compensation for his or her services as the Building Inspector. Whenever any
other person not holding any other village office is appointed as Building
Inspector, his or her compensation shall be fixed by the Village Manager.
   (C)   Powers and duties.
      (1)   General. Under the general supervision of the Director of Community
Development, the Building Inspector shall inspect all buildings and structures
being erected, altered, wrecked or moved and any other buildings or structures
which, in his or her opinion require it, for the purpose of determining whether
or not all laws and ordinances pertaining to the Department of Community
Development are being complied with.
      (2)   Power to stop work. The Building Inspector shall have the power to
stop any construction work which is being done in violation of any provision of
any ordinance relating thereto, and work shall not be resumed after the
issuance of a stop order except on written permission of the Building
Commissioner, Director of Community Development or Building Inspector.
      (3)   Access to premises. The Building Inspector shall have the right, in
accordance with all applicable laws and during reasonable hours, to enter any
building or premises within the village in the discharge of their official
duties.
      (4)   Records. The Building Inspector shall keep complete records of all
permits, inspections and activities of the Building Department.
§§ 32.14 THROUGH 32.19 RESERVED.
VILLAGE LEGAL COUNSEL
§ 32.20 EMPLOYMENT OF VILLAGE LEGAL COUNSEL.
   The corporate authorities shall employ an attorney or firm of attorneys as
the legal advisor to the village as an independent contractor or employee.
§ 32.21 COMPENSATION.
   The Village Legal Counsel shall receive such compensation as may, from time
to time, be approved by the Board of Trustees.
§ 32.22 DUTIES.
   The Village Legal Counsel shall advise the Board of Trustees and the Village
Manager, as well as all other village officers and employees as directed by the
Board of Trustees or by the Village Manager, in all matters of law in which the
interests of the village are involved; and when required by the President or
Board of Trustees or by the Village Manager, shall furnish written opinions
upon any subject submitted to the Village Legal Counsel pertaining to the
village and its interests. When requested by the President or Board of Trustees
or Village Manager, the Village Legal Counsel shall prepare all ordinances and
resolutions, contracts, leases and other documents or instruments to which the
village may be a party; and attend all regular and special meetings of the
Board of Trustees, attend board and commission meetings and committee meetings
of the Board of Trustees. The Village Legal Counsel shall, upon direction from
the Board of Trustees, assist any additional legal counsel employed pursuant to
§
32.24 of this code.
§ 32.23 SUITS AND ACTIONS.
   Except for the prosecution of ordinance violation cases, which the Village
Legal Counsel shall perform only when specifically so directed, the Village
Attorney shall prosecute or defend any and all suits or actions at law or
equity to which the village may be a party, or in which it may be interested,
or which may be brought against, or by, any officer of the village on behalf of
the village, or in the capacity of such person as an officer of the village.
§ 32.24 ADDITIONAL LEGAL COUNSEL.
   The corporate authorities may from time to time employ additional lawyers to
perform specialized, consultant or advisory services to the Village Legal
Counsel or the village. Specifically, and without limitation of the foregoing,
the corporate authorities may employ an attorney or firm of attorneys as the
Village Prosecutor for the village, either as an employee or as an independent
contractor. The Village Prosecutor shall prosecute all ordinance violations of
the village unless the Village Manager shall assign the prosecution of certain
cases to some other attorney. The Village Prosecutor shall notify the Village
Legal Counsel of any notice of appeal served in connection with the imposition
of any fine or other penalty for a violation of a village ordinance.
§§ 32.25 THROUGH 32.29 RESERVED.
POLICE DEPARTMENT
§ 32.30 CREATION AND COMPOSITION.
   There is hereby created a Police Department, an administrative department of
the village, which shall consist of the Chief of Police and of a number of
lieutenants, sergeants, patrol officers, deputies, special police officers, and
part-time officers, as may be from time to time provided by the Village Board,
and all of whom, other than the Chief, shall be employees of the village.
§ 32.31 CHIEF OF POLICE; OFFICE CREATED; TERMS.
   (A)   Position created. There is hereby created the position of Chief of
Police, who shall be an officer of the village. The President and Board of
Trustees, voting jointly, shall appoint the Chief of Police. The Chief of
Police shall hold office for the term established by the President and Board of
Trustees, voting jointly, or otherwise until his or her successor has been duly
appointed and qualified or until his or her removal from office by the
President and Board of Trustees, voting jointly.
   (B)   Powers and duties. Under the general supervision of the Village Board,
the Chief of Police shall have the following powers and duties:
      (1)   Administrative duties. The Chief shall have authority and
responsibility for the management, direction and control of operations and
administration of the Police Department.
      (2)   Law enforcement duties. The Chief of Police shall have
responsibility for the direction and control of law enforcement matters in the
village and shall be responsible for the enforcement of the provisions of this
code and the ordinances of the village.
      (3)   Keeper of village jail. The Chief of Police shall be the keeper of
the village jail and shall have custody of all persons incarcerated therein and
all property pertaining thereto.
      (4)   Duty to keep records. The Chief of Police shall make and keep
records and reports concerning the functions of the Police Department as may be
required by statute, ordinance or the Village Board.
      (5)   Duty to assign rank of member. The Chief of Police shall designate
the rank and grade of the members, and all designations, when approved by the
Village Board, shall be binding upon all members of the Police Department.
      (6)   Duty to make rules and regulations. The Chief of Police shall make
and prescribe rules and regulations for the conduct and guidance of the members
of the Police Department as the Chief of Police shall deem advisable, and all
such rules and regulations, when approved by the Village Board, shall be
binding upon all members of the Police Department.
      (7)   Discipline, suspension and discharge. The Chief of Police shall
have the authority to discipline, suspend without pay, or discharge any member
of the Police Department for any neglect of duty, misconduct, or for any other
valid reason, provided, however that any member of the Police Department so
disciplined, suspended, or discharged shall be entitled, and have the right,
within ten days, to file with the Public Safety/Community Affairs Committee of
the village a written request for a hearing before the Public Safety/Community
Affairs Committee, at which hearing the Chief of Police shall have the right to
be present. The Public Safety/Community Affairs Committee shall have full power
and authority to dispose of the matter brought before it.
      (8)   Additional powers and duties. The Chief of Police shall have any
other powers and duties as shall be assigned to the Chief of Police by law,
statute, ordinance, or by the Board of Trustees or its duly authorized
committees.
§ 32.32 EMPLOYMENT OF MEMBERS.
   (A)   The Village Board may from time to time specify the number of officers
(including regular, special, and/or part-time officers) to be employed by the
village. Whenever a vacancy occurs, the Chief shall, subject to the approval of
the Village Board, employ a new member to fill the position. In case of
emergency or in times of peril, danger, riot or pestilence, or apprehension
thereof, the Village President may appoint or employ special and part-time
police officers to act during the emergency, subject to the approval of the
Village Board at its next regular meeting.
   (B)   Hiring requirements of all officers.
      (1)   The following hiring requirements apply to all potential officers:
         (a)   Be of good moral character, of temperate habits, of sound
health, and physically and mentally able to perform assigned duties.
         (b)   Be at least 21 years of age.
            1.   No person shall be employed as a regular member of the
Department unless he or she is not more than 35 years of age at the time of the
beginning of the employment, nor until he or she has first passed the mental
and physical tests required by the Chief of Police.
         (c)   Pass a background check.
         (d)   Possess a high school diploma or GED certificate.
         (e)   Possess a valid State of Illinois driver’s license.
         (f)   Possess a valid FOID card.
      (2)   The village reserves the right to change or add to these
requirements as it deems appropriate.
   (C)   Part-time police officers.
      (1)   In accordance with the Illinois Pension Code (40 ILCS 5/3-109.a.1),
part-time police officers shall not be eligible to participate in the
Kenilworth Police Pension Fund.
      (2)   Duties. A part-time police officer shall have all the
responsibilities of a full-time police officer and such specific duties as
delineated in the policy manual of the Police Department, but the hours a part-
time police officer may work within a calendar year is restricted. Part-time
police officers shall not be assigned to supervise or direct full-time police
officers. Part-time police officers shall be trained in accordance with the
Police Training Act (50 ILCS 705/1 et seq.), and the rules of the Illinois Law
Enforcement Training and Standards Board. Part-time police officers shall
comply with all applicable rules and policies issued by the Police Department.
      (3)   Any part-time officer hired who has not yet received certification
under Section 8.2 of the Police Training Act (50 ILCS 705/8.2) shall be
directly supervised.
   (D)   All officers serve at the discretion of the village, shall not have
any property rights in said employment, and may be removed by the Chief of
Police at any time.
(Ord. 1078, passed 4-16-2012; Ord. 1380, passed 2-18-2025)
§ 32.33 RESERVED.
§ 32.34 OATH AND BOND OF MEMBERS.
   Before entering upon the duties of his or her appointment or employment,
every member of the Police Department shall take and subscribe to the oath of
office prescribed by law, but bond shall be required only of the Chief of
Police and lieutenants. Bond where required shall be conditioned as provided by
law and in an amount as is from time to time determined by ordinance or
resolution of the Village Board.
§ 32.35 POWERS AND DUTIES OF MEMBERS.
   (A)   General duties. It shall be the duty of every member of the Police
Department to preserve order, prevent infractions of the law, enforce all of
the ordinances of the village and all of the statutes and laws effective in the
village, and to arrest violators thereof.
   (B)   Serving warrants. Every member of the Police Department shall have the
common law and statutory powers of constables for the purpose of serving
warrants for the violation of village ordinances, and crimes and misdemeanors,
to whomsoever directed, within the corporate limits of the village; provided,
however, that all warrants shall be served under the direction and with the
approval of the Chief of Police.
   (C)   Appearing as witnesses; fees. Every member of the Police Department,
when called upon to do so, shall appear as a witness in any prosecution for
violation of any village ordinance or criminal law and in civil cases involving
the public interest as the Chief of Police may approve and direct. No member of
the Police Department shall receive any witness fee for his or her services as
a witness in any action or suit to which the village or the people of the state
are a party, and any witness fee or expense money paid that member in other
cases shall be turned over to the Chief of Police for deposit in the village
treasury.
§ 32.36 COMPENSATION.
   The Chief of Police and all members of the Police Department shall receive
compensation as fixed by the Village Board.
§ 32.37 CONSERVATORS OF THE PEACE.
   Upon the receipt of a certificate attesting to the successful completion of
a training course administered by the Illinois Law Enforcement Training
Standards Board in accordance with the Illinois Municipal Code (65 ILCS 5/3.1-
15-25), every member of the Police Department whose duty it is to enforce the
penal ordinances of the village, are hereby declared to be conservators of the
peace, with power to arrest or cause to be arrested, with or without process,
all persons who shall break the peace, or be found violating any ordinance of
the village or any criminal law of the state or of the United States of
America, and to commit for examination, and if necessary, detain those persons
in custody over night or Sunday or holidays, in the village jail or other safe
place, until they can be brought before the proper court, and shall have and
exercise all other powers as conservators of the peace as the corporate
authorities may prescribe.
§ 32.38 VILLAGE JAIL.
   (A)   The metal doored and barred rooms or cells in the Police Department
building, or any other place which is hereafter established by the Board of
Trustees for that purpose, shall be the jail of the village.
   (B)   The jail shall be used for the incarceration of any person arrested
until that person is brought before a magistrate or other properly constituted
legal tribunal for a hearing and admitted to bail or discharged, or until that
person is lawfully transferred to some other place of incarceration.
§§ 32.39 THROUGH 32.49 RESERVED.
FIRE DEPARTMENT
§ 32.50 CREATION OF DEPARTMENT.
   There is hereby created a Fire Department, an administrative department of
the village. The Fire Department shall consist of a Fire Marshal, who shall be
the Chief of the Fire Department, and the Chair and members of the Public
Safety/Community Affairs Committee as ex officio members, and/or any other
persons as may from time to time be appointed by the Village Board.
(Ord. 1265, passed 9-21-2020)
§ 32.51 FIRE MARSHAL OFFICE CREATED.
   (A)   Position created. There is hereby created the Office of Fire Marshal,
an administrative office of the village. The Chief of Police shall be the Fire
Marshal unless some other person shall be appointed to the office by the
Village Board of Trustees.
   (B)   Powers and duties. The Fire Marshal shall have the following powers
and duties:
      (1)   Investigation of fires. The Fire Marshal shall investigate the
nature, cause and extent of all fires in the village and keep a record thereof.
      (2)   Fire limits. The Fire Marshal or other officer in command at any
fire may prescribe limits in the vicinity of any fire, within which no person
except officers and persons who reside therein shall be admitted without
permission from a duly authorized officer.
      (3)   Removal and protection of property. The Fire Marshal shall have the
power to cause the removal of property whenever it shall become necessary for
the preservation of property from fire, or to prevent the spreading of fire or
to protect adjoining property.
      (4)   Deputy Building Inspector. The Fire Marshal shall be an ex officio
Deputy Building Inspector, and as such it shall be his or her duty to make
inspections and cooperate with the Building Commissioner and Inspectors in
administering and enforcing the provisions of this code relating to fire
inspections, fire prevention and public safety.
      (5)   Additional duties. The Fire Marshal shall enforce all ordinances
relating to the occurrence or spread of fires, and shall have any other powers
and perform any other duties as may be authorized or required by law, statute
or ordinance.
§ 32.52 ORGANIZATION AND APPOINTMENTS.
   Upon taking office and at any other times as the Board of Trustees may
direct, the Fire Marshal shall make those appointments and prescribe those
duties as may be necessary and proper for the organization and effective
operation of the Fire Department. The Fire Marshal shall control and supervise,
subject to the order and direction of the Village Board, all apparatus and
equipment owned by the village for the prevention and control of fires.
§ 32.53 SERVICES OF FIRE DEPARTMENTS OF OTHER MUNICIPALITIES.
   Whenever the village has entered into an agreement for the services of any
fire department of any nearby municipality, all fire calls shall be made in
accordance with the terms of that agreement. In case of emergency, the Fire
Marshal or other duly authorized members of the Fire Department shall have the
authority to call upon other nearby fire departments for assistance.
§ 32.54 AMBULANCE USER FEE.
   (A)   Definitions.
      (1)   For purposes of this section, BASIC LIFE SUPPORT AMBULANCE SERVICE
shall mean an emergency procedure that consists of the recognition and
treatment of injuries and ailments without the use of advanced medical
instruments or supplies.
      (2)   For purposes of this section, ADVANCED LIFE SUPPORT AMBULANCE
SERVICE shall mean an emergency life saving procedure that consists of the use
of advanced medical instruments or supplies, cardiac monitoring,
defibrillation, the maintenance of and intravenous life line or the infusion of
appropriate medications.
   (B)   Whenever the village has entered into an agreement for the services of
any fire department ambulance service of any nearby municipality, there shall
be an ambulance user fee for any person transported by the ambulance service
from within the village to a hospital or other care facility. The fee shall be
in an amount fixed from time to time by resolution of the Board of Trustees for
basic life support ambulance service or for advanced life support ambulance
service, as the case may be.
   (C)   The fees established pursuant to subsection (B) above shall be
assessed and paid in the following manner.
      (1)   Every person transported by the ambulance service who has in force
at the time of service any form of insurance that provides coverage for
ambulance service, including Medicare, Medicaid and private or self-insured
programs, shall be, for the purpose of this section, the insured.
      (2)   Any insured, by accepting the ambulance service provided, shall
thereby assign to the village or its contractor, and the village or its
contractor shall thereby become subrogated to, all rights to any of insurance
authorizing payment for ambulance service.
      (3)   Every insured transported by ambulance, or the spouse or
representative of the insured, or the insured’s parent or legal guardian if the
insured is a minor, shall provide to the village or its contractor all
information necessary to present a claim on behalf of the village or its
contractor and shall authorize the release of information to the village or its
contractor by any hospital or physician to whom the insured is transported by
ambulance.
      (4)   The village or its contractor shall file whatever claim may be
necessary to obtain payment from the insurance source. The village or its
contractor shall file claims on behalf of the insured with the primary insurer
or any secondary or supplemental insurance provider.
         (a)   In the event that the insurer requires an assignment accepting
the amount of the fee authorized by that insurer, the village or its contractor
will agree to the assignment and any amount of the user fee remaining unpaid
will be recovered in the manner set forth in subsection (C)(5) below.
         (b)   If the terms of the coverage available to the insured provide a
fixed fee less than the established ambulance user fee, or if the insurer, by
the terms of the agreement with the insured, or, as a consequence of any law or
regulation, is required to pay only a percentage of the fee, then any amount of
the user fee remaining unpaid will be recovered as set forth in subsection (C)
(5) below.
      (5)   The village shall provide in its annual budget, appropriation
ordinance and tax levy ordinance for an account against which a charge shall be
made for all user fees that remain unpaid, in whole or in part, after applying
all available underlying primary, secondary or supplemental insurance.
      (6)   The village or its contractor shall, upon request, provide an
insured with the documentation of any claim or payment.
